text:
The Singapore Swimming Club (SSC) was founded in 1894 by a group of European men who enjoyed swimming in the waters off Tanjong Rhu.

Spanning over 30,000 square meters of lush landscaped gardens, it has 2 large Olympic size pools. It has also a wide array of other sporting facilities including tennis, squash, badminton, pickleball, table tennis and bowling.

The 10 restaurants and bars also complement the range of activities to spend a whole day there.

Excellent variety of food and drinks ! Only for members ! Weekend have Indian vegetarian stall with lot of chaat items! Lot of activities for kids and adults ! Parking of plenty. Good function halls for events and wedding. Cafe is good too. Office space also available for rent. Security is prompt and helpful.

The food is amazing and my daughter loves the ham and cheese kids meal. The swimming pools are clean and there are also pools for youngsters. There is also a gym, a jacuzzi, a bouncy castle, a table tennis club, a  squash practice place and last but not least, a bowling centre and much more!
(Written by my 9-year old daughter who is a member)

Been coming here for years since I’ve been a kid. Always love how homely and family-friendly this place is. The eateries are fantastic, especially the cafe and Chinese restaurant. The club sports facilities are excellent, I’ve used the pool, tennis courts, bowling alley, and gym before. With the Katong Park station almost ready nearby, it will become even more accessible.

Went there for the second time as my aunt is their member. The first round tried their lunch buffet. Decent taste in many varieties. This round tried their fried hokkien mee. The taste was perfect, the portion was big. But wait for my local coffee for a long time. This really needs to improve
